turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Please drop by Starbucks on your way in to work this morning.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Do you want me to stop at the Long Road location in the Valley, or the Manchester Road store in Ballwin?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Stop by the Long Road location in the Valley.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: What should I order for you?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Please order me a latte macchiato.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: What size of drink would you like?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Make my coffee venti size please.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: What else can I pick up?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Please have Starbucks add three artificial sweeteners to the coffee.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Also ask them to add a splash of milk.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Whole milk, cream or 2% milk?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Ask them to use cream. That sounds good to me.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Should I stop by the office and pick up your Starbucks refillable travel cup?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: No just buy me another reusable travel cup.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Your focus on less pollution is admirable.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Thanks. Buy yourself a beverage also in a reusable travel cup.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Thanks. Hot chocolate sounds good to me this morning.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Thanks for stopping for my coffee on the way to work

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: I'll be to the office in about 30 minutes with your hot coffee drink and my hot chocolate.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Thanks. Drive safe.
